subject: Tennis
Australian Open (Tennis)
lead_paragraph: Roger Federer did not play poorly on Thursday, but unlike Novak Djokovic, he did not reserve his best for the critical phases, and that pattern repeated itself in every set.
snippet: Roger Federer did not play poorly on Thursday, but unlike Novak Djokovic, he did not reserve his best for the critical phases, and that pattern repeated itself in every set.
